p: The Salvia species, commonly referred to as sage, is one of the largest genera belonging to the Lamiaceae family of flowering plants, encompassing around 1000 species [ 14]. Various studies have shown several Salvia species to possess significant antioxidant and anti-inflammatory potential due to their bioactive components such as polyphenols, terpenoids, flavonoids, and other secondary metabolites. Furthermore, S. officinalis, S. miltiorrhiza, and S. sahendica have exhibited neuroprotective properties against A Î²-induced toxicity [ 9, 11, 15, 16], highlighting a possible use of Salvia species in treating AD.
